snippet: President Obama and Mitt Romney hunted for support in battleground states even as their parties faced off in the first court skirmishes over presidential ballots and how they are counted.
abstract: Pres Obama and Mitt Romney hunt for last-minute support in a frenetic sprint across battleground states, even as their parties face off in the first of what could be a growing number of legal disputes over presidential ballots and how they are counted; pre-election legal skirmishes are a potential preview of the clashes that could emerge in as many as a half-dozen swing states over voting on Nov 6.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Des Moines, Lizette Alvarez from Miami, and Michael Barbaro from Morrisville, Pa.

lead_paragraph: President Obama and Mitt Romney hunted for support in battleground states even as their parties faced off in the first court skirmishes over presidential ballots and how they are counted.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney Campaigns Begin Skirmish Over Balloting
headline.main: As Candidates Make Final Pleas, Legal Battles Begin
headline.print_headline: Candidates Make Last Pleas As Legal Skirmishes Begin
